titleStmt.title: Declaration of the Lords and Commons assembled in Parliament concerning His Majesties advancing with his army toward London : with direction that all the trained bands and volunteers be put into a readinesse : also how Sir Iohn Hinderson urged one David Alexander a Scotchman to kill Sir Iohn Hotham and blow up the Parliaments magazine : to who His Majesty gave money and he received it : together with the depositions of the said David Alexander and Sir Iohn Hinderson : whereunto is added severall votes of the Lords and Commons, corrected and amended by the House of Commons to prevent false copies.
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Parliament.
Alexander, David, 17th cent.
Gerbier, Balthazar, Sir, 1592?-1667.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for Edw. Husbands and I. Franke,

notesStmt.note: The second deponent is not Henderson but Sir Balthazar Gerbier.
An earlier issue omits phrase "to prevent false copies" from title.
Reproduction of original in Thomason Collection, British Library.
